data.message: I can think of one exception.  My favorite place is Church.  I had been to church for years, but until I was truly born again, saved simply by believing God loves me and gave His Son for my salvation, it was not my favorite place.  Moral of the story, at least mine, is that a place changes depending upon with whom you share it.

replies.message: well said and sooooo true!
Paul, I don't know you, and so agree with how a place changes because we shared it with someone.  Forever...
AMEN
My favorite place is homeswet home. Elsa
Paul very well put.
God bless you Paul
Knock, seek and ask, and it shall be given to you.
Praise God Paul!  Will see you in Heaven some day soon!  AMEN!!!
Paul that's truly it in a nutshell! Very well said! Amen
So true!!!  Right on!!!  I don't know you either but you hit the nail right on the head!!!
Ok! I can attest to that!
I am with you, same story, Paul.
Naku, mukhang papuntang dagat yang daanan! Baka merong  mga clams and suso sa dagat pag low tide prend!!
Amen

Sadly our church buildings are full of those who have not been born again. 
Paul, I rejoice with you. When your eyes and heart has been opened by the Holy Spirit to see what Jesus has done on the cross for all who will believe and accept His Love, you will become that New Creation. Old things pass away and all things become new. Praise The Lord.
Amen brother...saving grace :)
*gag*
Majority wins :)
What percentage of the bible have you god nut jobs  read? Wonder if you know what you're even praising

@Cory Gallimore    I am just as much of a non-believer as you, but I never found disparagement or (heavily one-sided) debating to be worth anyone's time. Chances are no one will renounce their faith because of what someone said online, no matter how much evidence you lay in from of them. Even if you use bible verses to question the religion, some will just tell you they believe in the teachings of Jesus. Beliefs can and will be altered to fit present-day cultural norms, even if that means some passages are ignored by theists.
